comments:
Build: 20020212

Description:
I was just fiddling with the settings on my test project (I'm self-hosting and 
need a place to try things without mucking up the UI code.)  I chose Properties 
from the context menu on the project (which is not in a repository anywhere), 
then looked through various property pages, including the CVS page, then 
changed the launch configuration to Java Application, and then pressed OK.  I 
got an internal error in the CVS page's performOk() method.  

Stack (From "Internal Error" Dialog):
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.CVSPropertiesPage.performOk
(CVSPropertiesPage.java:204)
	at org.eclipse.jface.preference.PreferenceDialog.okPressed
(PreferenceDialog.java:524)

(Compiled Code))

(Compiled Code))

(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:1205)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:788)

Was this actually on a CVS-shared project? There was a bug recently where the
CVS page would (Erroneously) show up on projects that were not shared with CVS,
in which case an error would occur when showing/finishing the page.

Can you reproduce this?

Yes, I can reproduce this in build 20020214.  The project is not shared with 
CVS so this is probably a duplicate of the bug you mention.  However, the error 
only occurs when I try to close the dialog by pressing OK.

For example:

1.  Select a project in the navigator which is not shared with CVS.
2.  Right click and choose properties in the context menu.
3.  CVS is an item in the list of property pages.
4.  Click on the CVS node to instantiate the CVS properties page.
5.  (Optional) Click on another property page.
6.  Click on OK.
7.  I get a null pointer exception in the following method: 
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.CVSPropertiesPage.performOk
and the dialog does not close.
8.  Click on cancel and everything's OK.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 7406 ***
